events.originalText: A tornado struck Central Oklahoma, killing 8 people and injuring more than 150.
events.subtitle: 2013 El Reno tornado
events.headline: Tornado kills 8 in Central Oklahoma

events.originalText: American physician George Tiller, one of the few doctors in the country who performed late-term abortions, was shot and killed by Scott Roeder, an anti-abortion activist.
events.subtitle: George Tiller
events.headline: George Tiller shot and killed by anti-abortion activist

events.originalText: A Vanity Fair article revealed that the secret informant known as "Deep Throat", who had provided information about the Watergate scandal, was former FBI associate director Mark Felt (pictured).
events.subtitle: Vanity Fair (magazine)
events.headline: Mark Felt revealed as 'Deep Throat' informant

events.originalText: An organized mob of police and government-sponsored Sinhalese paramilitary forces began three days of attacks that led to the burning of the Jaffna Library in Sri Lanka.
events.subtitle: Sinhalese people
events.headline: Jaffna Library burned in Sri Lanka attacks

events.originalText: German forces dropped four bombs on neutral Ireland, killing 28 people and damaging the residence of the President of Ireland.
events.subtitle: Bombing of Dublin in World War II
events.headline: German forces bomb neutral Ireland, killing 28

events.originalText: The United Kingdom completed its re-occupation of Iraq, returning Abd al-Ilah to power as regent for Faisal II.
events.subtitle: Anglo-Iraqi War
events.headline: UK re-occupies Iraq, Abd al-Ilah returns to power

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 7.7 Mw struck Balochistan in British India, now part of Pakistan, killing between 30,000 and 60,000 people.
events.subtitle: 1935 Quetta earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake in Balochistan kills 30,000-60,000

events.originalText: The Second Boer War came to an end with the signing of the Treaty of Vereeniging in Pretoria, South Africa.
events.subtitle: Second Boer War
events.headline: Second Boer War ends with Treaty of Vereeniging

events.originalText: Gilmore's Garden in New York City was renamed Madison Square Garden, the city's first venue to use that name.
events.subtitle: Madison Square Garden (1879)
events.headline: Gilmore's Garden renamed Madison Square Garden

events.originalText: American Civil War: Confederate troops under Joseph E. Johnston and G. W. Smith engaged Union forces under George B. McClellan at the Battle of Seven Pines outside Richmond, Virginia.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Battle of Seven Pines outside Richmond, Virginia

events.originalText: American Revolution: The Committee of Safety of Mecklenburg County, North Carolina, adopted the Mecklenburg Resolves, which annulled and vacated all laws originating from the authority of the King or Parliament.
events.subtitle: American Revolution
events.headline: Mecklenburg Resolves annul laws from King or Parliament

events.originalText: Cardinal Bessarion (pictured) announced his donation of 746 Greek and Latin codices to the Republic of Venice, forming the Biblioteca Marciana.
events.subtitle: Bessarion
events.headline: Cardinal Bessarion donates codices to Venice

events.originalText: Majapahit forces under Raden Wijaya won a major victory in the Mongol invasion of Java, now considered to be the founding date of the Indonesian city of Surabaya.
events.subtitle: Majapahit
events.headline: Majapahit forces win victory in Mongol invasion of Java

events.originalText: Mongol invasion of Kievan Rus': Mongol forces defeated a Kievan Rus' army at the Kalka River in present-day Ukraine.
events.subtitle: Mongol invasion of Kievan Rus'
events.headline: Mongol forces defeat Kievan Rus' army at Kalka River

events.originalText: A Mongol army under Genghis Khan captures Zhongdu (modern Beijing), the capital of the Jin dynasty.
events.subtitle: Mongol Empire
events.headline: Genghis Khan captures Zhongdu (modern Beijing)

events.originalText: Petronius Maximus, ruler of the Western Roman Empire, was stoned to death by a mob as he fled Rome ahead of the arrival of a Vandal force that sacked the city.
events.subtitle: Petronius Maximus
events.headline: Petronius Maximus stoned to death by mob
